Table of Contents

Name

tslibdev - Touchscreen library input driver

Synopsis


Section "InputDevice"
  Identifier "idevname"
  Driver "tslibdev"
  Option "Protocol" "protoname"
  Option "Device"   "devpath"
  ...
EndSection

Description

tslibdev is an Xorg input driver for touchscreen devices suppported by the tslib library.

The tslibdev driver functions as a pointer input device, and may be used as the X server's core pointer.

Supported Hardware

This driver can be configured to support any hardware that is supported by the tslib library.

Configuration Details

Please refer to xorg.conf(5x) for general configuration details and for options that can be used with all input drivers. This section only covers configuration details specific to this driver.

The following driver Options are supported:

Option "Protocol" "string"
The protocol string will be specified as an event type to use to the tslib library. Any protocol supported by the tslib library can be used. At the time of this writing, the following protocols are known to be supported:
InputAPI
Supports the Linux input event API. Can be used with any touchscreen driver that supports the input event API. This is the default protocol.
UCB1x00
Supports UCB1x00 touchscreen events.
H3600
Supports iPAQ h3600 style touchscreen events.
MK712
Supports Hitachi Webpad touchscreen events.
ARCTIC2
Supports IBM Arctic II touchscreen events.
COLLIE
Supports Sharp Zaurus SL-5000d/5500 touchscreen events.
CORGI
Supports Sharp Zaurus SL-C700 touchscreen events.
Option "Device" "string"
Specifies the device name through which the touchscreen device can be accessed. The default setting is "/dev/input/event0", which corresponds to the first device created by the Linux input event API.

See Also

Xorg(1x) , xorg.conf(5x) , xorgconfig(1x) , Xserver(1x) , X(7) .
